# contentRect(forBounds:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the rectangle in which the receiver draws its entire content.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func contentRect(forBounds bounds: CGRect) -> CGRect
```

## Parameters

- **bounds**: The bounding rectangle for the receiver.

## Return Value

The rectangle in which the receiver draws its entire content.

## Discussion

The content rectangle is the area needed to display the image and title including any padding and adjustments for alignment and other settings.

## Related Documentation

- **contentEdgeInsets**: The inset or outset margins for the rectangle surrounding all of the button’s content.

## Dimensions

- **backgroundRect(forBounds:)**: Returns the rectangle in which the receiver draws its background.
- **titleRect(forContentRect:)**: Returns the rectangle in which the receiver draws its title.
- **imageRect(forContentRect:)**: Returns the rectangle in which the receiver draws its image.
